cache_inode_rename.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00095 #include "LRU_List.h"
00096 #include "log_functions.h"

00106 #include <pthread.h>
00107 
00108 
00126 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_rename_cached_dirent( cache_entry_t        * pentry_parent,
00127                                                        fsal_name_t          * oldname,
00128                                                        fsal_name_t          * newname,
00129                                                        hash_table_t         * ht,
00130                                                        cache_inode_client_t * pclient,
00131                                                        cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00132 {
00133   cache_entry_t              * removed_pentry = NULL ;
00134 
00135   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00136   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00137 
00138   /* Sanity check */
00139   if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00140       pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00141     {
00142       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00143       return *pstatus ;
00144     }
00145 
00146   /* BUGAZOMEU: Ne pas oublier de jarter un dir_cont dont toutes les entrees sont inactives */
00147   if( ( removed_pentry = cache_inode_operate_cached_dirent( pentry_parent,
00148                                                             oldname,
00149                                                             newname,
00150                                                             CACHE_INODE_DIRENT_OP_RENAME,
00151                                                             pstatus ) ) == NULL )
00152     return *pstatus ;
00153 
00154 
00155   return *pstatus ;
00156 } /* cache_inode_rename_cached_dirent */
00157  
00180 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_rename( cache_entry_t           * pentry_dirsrc,
00181                                          fsal_name_t             * poldname,
00182                                          cache_entry_t           * pentry_dirdest, 
00183                                          fsal_name_t             * pnewname, 
00184                                          fsal_attrib_list_t      * pattr_src, 
00185                                          fsal_attrib_list_t      * pattr_dst, 
00186                                          hash_table_t            * ht,
00187                                          cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00188                                          fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext, 
00189                                          cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus)
00190 {
00191   cache_inode_status_t    status ;
00192   fsal_status_t           fsal_status ;
00193   cache_entry_t         * pentry_lookup_src  = NULL ;
00194   cache_entry_t         * pentry_lookup_dest = NULL ;
00195   fsal_attrib_list_t      attrlookup ;
00196   fsal_attrib_list_t    * pattrsrc ;
00197   fsal_attrib_list_t    * pattrdest ;
00198   fsal_handle_t         * phandle_dirsrc ;
00199   fsal_handle_t         * phandle_dirdest ;
00200   
00201   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00202   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00203   
00204    /* stats */
00205   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00206   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00207   
00208   /* Are we working on directories ? */
00209   if( ( pentry_dirsrc->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING && pentry_dirsrc->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE ) ||
00210       ( pentry_dirdest->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING && pentry_dirdest->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE ) )
00211     {
00212       /* Bad type .... */
00213       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00214       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00215 
00216       return *pstatus ;
00217     }
00218     
00219     
00220   /* Must take locks on directories now,
00221    * because if another thread checks source and destination existence
00222    * in the same time, it will try to do the same checks...
00223    * and it will have the same conclusion !!!
00224    */
00225     
00226   /* Get the locks on bot pentry. If the same if used twice (as src and dest), take only one lock.
00227    * Lock are acquired has their related pentry are allocated (to avoid deadlocks) */
00228   if( pentry_dirsrc == pentry_dirdest )
00229     P_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;
00230   else
00231     {
00232       if( pentry_dirsrc < pentry_dirdest )
00233         {
00234            P_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;
00235            P_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00236         }
00237       else
00238         {
00239           P_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00240           P_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;
00241         }
00242     }
00243 
00244             
00245     
00246   /* Check for object existence in source directory */
00247   if( ( pentry_lookup_src = cache_inode_lookup_no_mutex( pentry_dirsrc, 
00248                                                          poldname, 
00249                                                          &attrlookup, 
00250                                                          ht,
00251                                                          pclient,
00252                                                          pcontext,
00253                                                          pstatus ) ) == NULL )
00254     {
00255       /* Source object does not exist */
00256       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00257     
00258       /* If FSAL FH is staled, then this was managed in cache_inode_lookup */ 
00259       if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE )  
00260         *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND ;
00261       
00262       V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00263       if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00264         {
00265           V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00266         }
00267 
00268       if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ) 
00269         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename (%p,%s)->(%p,%s) : source doesn't exist",
00270                           pentry_dirsrc, poldname->name, pentry_dirdest, pnewname->name );
00271       else
00272         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename : stale source" ) ;
00273 
00274       
00275       return *pstatus ;
00276     }
00277       
00278   /* Check if an object with the new name exists in the destination directory */
00279   if( ( pentry_lookup_dest = cache_inode_lookup_no_mutex( pentry_dirdest, 
00280                                                           pnewname, 
00281                                                           &attrlookup,
00282                                                           ht,
00283                                                           pclient,
00284                                                           pcontext,
00285                                                           pstatus ) ) != NULL )
00286     {
00287       
00288       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename (%p,%s)->(%p,%s) : destination already exists",
00289                          pentry_dirsrc, poldname->name, pentry_dirdest, pnewname->name );
00290             
00291       /* If the already existing object is a directory, source object should ne a directory */
00292       if( pentry_lookup_dest->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING &&
00293           pentry_lookup_src->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING )
00294         {
00295           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00296           if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00297             {
00298               V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00299             }
00300           
00301           /* Return EISDIR */
00302           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00303           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_IS_A_DIRECTORY ;
00304           
00305           return *pstatus ;
00306         }
00307       
00308       if( pentry_lookup_dest->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00309           pentry_lookup_src->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00310         {
00311           /* Return ENOTDIR */
00312           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00313           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_A_DIRECTORY ;
00314 
00315           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00316           if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00317             {
00318               V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00319             }
00320 
00321           return *pstatus ;
00322         }
00323 
00324       /* If caller wants to rename a file on himself, let it do it: return CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS but do nothing */
00325       if( pentry_lookup_dest == pentry_lookup_src )
00326         {
00327           /* There is in fact only one file (may be one of the arguments is a hard link to the other) */
00328           
00329           /* Return SUCCESS */
00330           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;          
00331           *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry_dirdest, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;  
00332           
00333           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00334           if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00335             {
00336               V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00337             }
00338                     
00339           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename (%p,%s)->(%p,%s) : rename the object on itself",
00340                              pentry_dirsrc, poldname->name, pentry_dirdest, pnewname->name );
00341 
00342           return *pstatus ;
00343         }
00344 
00345       /* Entry with the newname exists, if it is a non-empty directory, operation cannot be performed */
00346       if( ( pentry_lookup_dest->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ) &&
00347           ( cache_inode_is_dir_empty( pentry_lookup_dest ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) )
00348         {
00349           /* The entry is a non-empty directory */
00350           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00351           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY  ;
00352          
00353           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00354           if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00355             {
00356               V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00357             }
00358           
00359           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename (%p,%s)->(%p,%s) : destination is a non-empty directory",
00360                              pentry_dirsrc, poldname->name, pentry_dirdest, pnewname->name );
00361           return *pstatus ;
00362         }
00363         
00364     
00365       /* get ride of this entry by trying removing it */
00366 
00367       status = cache_inode_remove_no_mutex(  pentry_dirdest, 
00368                                              pnewname, 
00369                                              &attrlookup, 
00370                                              ht, 
00371                                              pclient, 
00372                                              pcontext, 
00373                                              pstatus ) ;
00374       if( status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00375         {
00376           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00377           *pstatus = status ;
00378 
00379           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00380           if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00381             {
00382               V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00383             }
00384 
00385           return *pstatus ;
00386         }
00387            
00388     } /* if( pentry_lookup_dest != NULL ) */
00389   else
00390    {
00391      if( *pstatus == CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE )
00392       {
00393         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename : stale destnation" ) ;
00394 
00395         
00396         V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;
00397         if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00398           {
00399              V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00400           }
00401 
00402         return *pstatus ;
00403       }
00404    }
00405  
00406     
00407   /* Get the handle for the dirsrc pentry */
00408     
00409   if( pentry_dirsrc->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00410     {
00411       phandle_dirsrc = &pentry_dirsrc->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00412       pattrsrc = &pentry_dirsrc->object.dir_begin.attributes ;
00413     }
00414   else if( pentry_dirsrc->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00415     {
00416       P_r( &pentry_dirsrc->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00417 
00418       phandle_dirsrc = &pentry_dirsrc->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00419       pattrsrc = &pentry_dirsrc->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.attributes ;
00420 
00421       V_r( &pentry_dirsrc->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00422     }
00423   else
00424     {
00425       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00426       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00427 
00428       V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00429       if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00430         {
00431           V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00432         }
00433 
00434       return *pstatus ;
00435     }
00436 
00437     
00438   /* Get the handle for the dirdest pentry */
00439     
00440   if( pentry_dirdest->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00441     {
00442       phandle_dirdest = &pentry_dirdest->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00443       pattrdest = &pentry_dirdest->object.dir_begin.attributes ;
00444     }
00445   else if ( pentry_dirdest->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00446     {
00447       P_r( &pentry_dirdest->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00448 
00449       phandle_dirdest = &pentry_dirdest->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00450       pattrdest = &pentry_dirdest->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.attributes ;
00451       
00452       V_r( &pentry_dirdest->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00453     }
00454   else
00455     {
00456       V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00457       if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00458         {
00459           V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00460         }
00461 
00462       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00463       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00464 
00465       V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;
00466       if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00467         V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00468               
00469       return *pstatus ;
00470     }
00471     
00472     
00473         
00474     /* Perform the rename operation in FSAL,
00475      * before doing anything in the cache.
00476      * Indeed, if the FSAL_rename fails unexpectly,
00477      * the cache would be inconsistent !
00478      */
00479 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00480     fsal_status = MFSL_rename( &pentry_dirsrc->mobject, 
00481                                poldname, 
00482                                &pentry_dirdest->mobject, 
00483                                pnewname, 
00484                                pcontext, 
00485                                &pclient->mfsl_context,
00486                                pattrsrc, 
00487                                pattrdest ) ;
00488 #else
00489     fsal_status = FSAL_rename( phandle_dirsrc, 
00490                                poldname, 
00491                                phandle_dirdest, 
00492                                pnewname, 
00493                                pcontext, 
00494                                pattrsrc, 
00495                                pattrdest ) ;
00496 #endif
00497     if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00498       {
00499         *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00500         pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00501 
00502         V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00503         if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00504           {
00505             V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00506           }
00507 
00508         if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00509           {
00510              cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00511              fsal_status_t        getattr_status ;
00512 
00513              DisplayLog( "cache_inode_rename: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for at least one in  pentry = %p and pentry = %p", 
00514                         pentry_dirsrc, pentry_dirdest ) ;
00515 
00516            /* Use FSAL_getattrs to find which entry is staled */
00517            getattr_status = FSAL_getattrs(  phandle_dirsrc, pcontext, &attrlookup ) ;
00518            if( getattr_status.major == ERR_FSAL_ACCESS )
00519             {
00520                DisplayLog( "cache_inode_rename: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_dirsrc ) ;
00521 
00522                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_dirsrc, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00523                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_rename: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_dirsrc, kill_status ) ;
00524             }           
00525 
00526            getattr_status = FSAL_getattrs(  phandle_dirdest, pcontext, &attrlookup ) ;
00527            if( getattr_status.major == ERR_FSAL_ACCESS )
00528             {
00529                DisplayLog( "cache_inode_rename: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_dirdest ) ;
00530 
00531                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_dirdest, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00532                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_rename: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_dirdest, kill_status ) ;
00533             }           
00534        
00535            *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00536         
00537           }
00538 
00539         return *pstatus ;
00540       }
00541 
00542     /* Manage the returned attributes */
00543     if( pattr_src != NULL )
00544       *pattr_src = *pattrsrc ;
00545 
00546     if( pattr_dst != NULL )
00547       *pattr_dst = *pattrdest ;
00548 
00549     
00550     
00551   /* At this point, we know that:
00552    *  - both pentry_dir_src and pentry_dir_dest are directories 
00553    *  - pentry_dir_src/oldname exists
00554    *  - pentry_dir_dest/newname does not exists or has just been removed */
00555  
00556  if( pentry_dirsrc == pentry_dirdest )
00557     { 
00558        /* if the rename operation is made within the same dir, then we use an optimization:
00559         * cache_inode_rename_dirent is used instead of adding/removing dirent. This limits
00560         * the use of resource in this case */
00561 
00562       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename (%p,%s)->(%p,%s) : source and target directory are the same",
00563                          pentry_dirsrc, poldname->name, pentry_dirdest, pnewname->name );
00564 
00565       status = cache_inode_rename_cached_dirent( pentry_dirdest, 
00566                                                  poldname,
00567                                                  pnewname,
00568                                                  ht,
00569                                                  pclient,
00570                                                  pstatus ) ;
00571 
00572       if( status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00573        {
00574           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00575           *pstatus = status ;
00576         
00577           /* Unlock the pentry and exits */ 
00578           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00579       
00580           return *pstatus ;
00581         }
00582     }
00583   else
00584     { 
00585       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Rename (%p,%s)->(%p,%s) : moving entry",
00586                          pentry_dirsrc, poldname->name, pentry_dirdest, pnewname->name );
00587 
00588       
00589       /* Add the new entry */
00590       status = cache_inode_add_cached_dirent( pentry_dirdest, 
00591                                               pnewname, 
00592                                               pentry_lookup_src, 
00593                                               NULL, 
00594                                               ht, 
00595                                               pclient, 
00596                                               pcontext, 
00597                                               pstatus ) ;
00598       if( status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00599         {
00600           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00601           *pstatus = status ;
00602       
00603       
00604           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00605           if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00606             {
00607               V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00608             }
00609       
00610           return *pstatus ;
00611         }
00612 
00613       /* Remove the old entry */
00614       if( cache_inode_remove_cached_dirent( pentry_dirsrc, 
00615                                             poldname, 
00616                                             ht, 
00617                                             pclient, 
00618                                             &status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00619         {
00620           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00621           *pstatus = status ;
00622       
00623           V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00624           if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00625             {
00626               V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00627             }
00628       
00629           return *pstatus ;
00630         }
00631      }
00632        
00633     
00634   /* Validate the entries */
00635   *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry_dirsrc, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;  
00636 
00637   /* stat */
00638   if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00639     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00640   else
00641     {
00642       *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry_dirdest, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;  
00643       
00644       if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00645         pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00646       else
00647         pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_RENAME] += 1 ;
00648     }
00649   
00650   /* unlock entries */
00651     
00652   V_w( &pentry_dirsrc->lock ) ;          
00653   if(  pentry_dirsrc !=  pentry_dirdest )
00654     {
00655       V_w( &pentry_dirdest->lock ) ;
00656     }
00657 
00658   return *pstatus ;
00659 } /* cache_inode_rename */
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:28 2009 for Cache inode layer by  1.5.7.1
